summary: In this context, ethylbenzene and toluene are both components of a BTEX (Benzene, Toluene, Ethylbenzene, and Xylenes) mixture used for analytical purposes. They are mentioned as part of a standard mixture prepared for sampling and analysis, indicating their co-occurrence in environmental studies. However, there is no detailed discussion of their specific interactions or functional relationships beyond their inclusion in the same mixture.
